org.cougaar.util
Class ArrayMap

java.lang.Object
  org.cougaar.util.ArrayMap
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.Map
Direct Known Subclasses:
PropertyTree
public class ArrayMap
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Map, java.lang.Cloneable, java.io.Serializable

An implementation of Map that maintains the elements in the order they were added, as opposed to the random order of a HashMap. An ArrayMap is a Map, and can be used exactly like a typical Map. The most significant differences are that

  1. The elements are kept in the order that they are added.
  2. One can restrict the (key, value) types by overriding createEntry(Object key, Object value).
  3. There are index-based "getters", such as getKey(int).

See Also:
Map, Serialized Form

    get

    public java.util.Map.Entry get(int index)
    Get the Map.Entry at the specifed offset of the entrySet().iterator(). Maps typically don't define an indexable ordering. However, an ArrayMap is defined to be sorted in the order that the elements were added, so let's make this function available.
